### Overview

The *Building Open Connected Scientific Data Products for the Cryosphere* hackdays will take place **April 13--15, 2026** in **Berkeley, CA**. The workshop is hosted by [Englacial](https://englacial.org) and [Berkeley Institute for Data Science](https://bids.berkeley.edu/), with support from [Astera](https://astera.org/).

This three-day workshop brings together scientists, data providers, open-source engineers, and other experts to collaboratively improve open science workflows and test new ways of building open, connected scientific data products.

We'll explore new tools and publishing alternatives for today's changing science landscape, while we design and co-create for a future where results are available faster and reproducing and building on the work of others is easier. We welcome observationalists, modellers, and engineers to come exchange ideas and tools for building dynamic links between data and models through open source software.

### What to expect

The workshop will provide time and space for attendees to form small groups and work on building prototypes of connected data products. Instead of traditional talks, we'll feature invited demos -- interactive demonstrations by leaders in open science showcasing tools and data products they have built.

Day 3 will end with time for teams to briefly present their projects and non-traditional artifacts for sharing science.

### Goals

* Bring together observationalists, modellers, and engineers to exchange ideas and tools for building dynamic links between data and models through open-source software
* Foster conversations around how to scale, share, and publish open science in a post-journals world
* Promote awareness of existing open-source tools for data access, analysis, and sharing

### Logistics

* **Dates:** April 13--15, 2026 (Monday--Wednesday)
* **Location:** Emeryville, CA (April 13) and Berkeley, CA (April 14--15)
* **Capacity:** ~30 participants
* **Travel support:** We will provide travel support to non-local participants. Please wait for instructions before booking your travel.

### Questions

Any questions about the hackdays should be sent to [shane.grigsby@astera.org](mailto:shane.grigsby@astera.org).
